About Us
We are a 55+, pet friendly manufactured home and RV Co-op community that offers owner-occupied ground lease and Co-op lots.  We offer an affordable, old Florida tropical community with palms, pines, live oaks, Spanish moss, friendly people and a great location, adjacent to a 300 acre Nature Preserve. Walk to shopping, dining, banks and a bus stop. Our social committee organizes holiday events, breakfasts, ice cream socials, card games, bingo and more!
It is simply a wonderful place to call home.
Residents with lot leases pay $590/month for lake front, $580/month for a standard lot.
Resale homes are sometimes available. Contact a local realtor for more information.
Vero Beach - One of Travel & Leisure's Magazines top 10 beaches

Tanglewood Community Events
Vero Beach Pipes and Drums at the Green Marlin restaurant on St Paddy's Day, 2025. Tanglewood residents Betty Ledingham and Marion Hamilton perform with group.
Food Drop Schedule 2025
Food Drops will be scheduled for the first Friday of each month. The following are the dates for each month in 2025. (Please note that the dates are tentative and could be changed at any time. Will update as necessary.)
February 7
March 14
April 4
May 2
June 6
July 4
August 1
September 5
October 3
November 7
December 5
On Food Drop Days, please wait for truck(s) to be unloaded and leave the area before entering clubhouse. Thanks.

Food supplies are delivered on the last Thursday of each month, except months of November and December. Due to the holidays  we distribute one week earlier.
Attention Residents:
Yellow Dot Program
The Indian River County sheriff's office has a Yellow Dot Program. You affix a decal to the rear window of your car and put a competed form in your glove compartment. It is used if you are unconscious, unable to speak and require medical attention. The sheriffs department will bring the form to the hospital to aide in your medical care.There are decals and forms in the clubhouse for your convenience.
